alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 3:41AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Midland, Bay and Saginaw Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the Friday evening commute. Gusty winds may bring down snow covered tree branches resulting in scattered power outages. Blowing snow may reduce visibilities to below one mile at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates are expected to peak in excess of one inch per hour this evening with steady snow continuing into tonight. Snowfall totals could approach 12 inches across the most northern portions of Midland and Bay Counties by Saturday afternoon. Strong winds are expected late tonight into Saturday with gusts of up to 45 mph as arctic air filters in behind the system sending wind chill values close to zero.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
